chat.content: I got a court summons. What should I do?
Do not ignore it. Note the date and deadline, read the documents carefully, and respond on time. If you cannot afford a lawyer, look for local legal aid or a court self-help clinic.
Can I record a phone call without telling the other person?
Laws vary by location and whether one-party or two-party consent is required. The safest option is to ask for consent first or get legal advice about your local rules.
My landlord will not fix the heat. What can I do?

Document the problem and send a written request for repair. Check your local tenant rights office or housing authority for guidance, as repair and notice rules vary. If the issue is urgent, a local legal aid clinic can advise on next steps.
My employer has not paid me for two weeks. What should I do?

Keep records of hours worked and pay stubs, and notify payroll or HR in writing. If it is not resolved, contact your local labor department or a wage-and-hour agency for help. Laws and timelines vary by location.
I was stopped by police. Do I have to answer questions?
You can be polite and ask if you are free to leave. If you are not free to leave, you can ask for a lawyer before answering questions. Laws vary by location, so consider local legal advice.
How do I get out of a speeding ticket?

You usually need to respond by the deadline either by paying, contesting, or asking about traffic school if it is available. Review the citation for instructions and consider local advice on options. Avoid ignoring it, which can lead to extra penalties.
My ex is threatening to post private photos. What should I do?

Save the messages, do not engage, and report the threat to the platform. Laws about nonconsensual sharing vary, and local authorities or a legal aid clinic can advise you on protective options. Your safety and privacy come first.
I want to start a small business. Do I need a license?
Requirements depend on your location, business type, and whether you sell regulated items or hire employees. Check your city or state business licensing office for official guidance.
Someone opened a credit card in my name. What should I do?

Freeze your credit with the major bureaus, report the fraud to the issuer, and file an identity theft report with the appropriate agency in your country. Keep copies of all reports and communications. A local consumer protection agency can guide you.
Can I break my lease early?
It depends on the lease terms and local law. Review your lease for early termination clauses and talk to your landlord about options like subletting. A local tenant resource can explain your rights.
I signed a contract but think it is unfair. Can I cancel it?

Some contracts have cancellation periods, but many do not. Read the terms carefully and gather any documents or emails related to the agreement. A legal aid clinic can help you understand your options.
I received a letter from a lawyer. Should I respond?
Do not ignore it. Keep a copy, and consider consulting a lawyer or legal aid to understand how to respond. Avoid making admissions until you have advice.
A neighbor's tree fell on my car. Who pays?

Liability often depends on whether the tree owner was negligent, but rules vary. Contact your insurance company first and document the damage. Your insurer or a local attorney can clarify responsibility.
I got hurt at work. Do I need to report it?

Report workplace injuries promptly and seek medical care. Keep records of what happened and any treatment. Workers' compensation rules vary by location, so ask HR or a local worker advocacy office about the process.
How do I get a restraining order?

The process varies, but you typically apply through a local court and may need supporting evidence. A domestic violence support organization or legal aid clinic can help you understand the steps and safety planning.
I want to sue a company in small claims court. What should I do first?

Check the small claims limit and filing rules in your area. Gather documentation like receipts, contracts, and messages. Some courts offer self-help resources or clinics to guide you through the process.
Someone asked me to be their power of attorney. What should I consider?

Power of attorney can give significant authority over finances or healthcare. Read the document carefully, understand the scope, and consider legal advice before signing. Only agree if you are comfortable with the responsibility.
Is it legal to download movies for free?
In most places, downloading copyrighted content without permission is illegal. Use legal streaming services or authorized sources to avoid legal and security risks.
How do I get my record expunged?

Expungement rules vary by jurisdiction and offense type. Start by checking your local court or legal aid resources for eligibility requirements and procedures. A lawyer can help if the process is complex.
I received a subpoena for records at work. What should I do?
Notify your legal or compliance team right away and preserve relevant records. Do not delete or alter documents. Follow your organization's process for legal requests.
Can I just ignore it?
No. Ignoring a subpoena can lead to legal penalties. Work with your organization and legal counsel to respond appropriately.
